parties.raw_snippet:
TRANSFER AND SERVICING AGREEMENT, dated as of January 29, 2020 (this “Agreement”), among VERIZON OWNER TRUST 2020-A,
a Delaware statutory trust, as issuer (the “Issuer”), VERIZON ABS LLC, a Delaware limited liability company, as depositor (the “Depositor”), and
Cellco Partnership d/b/a Verizon Wireless, a Delaware general partnership (“Cellco”), as servicer (in such capacity, the “Servicer”), as marketing
agent (in such capacity, the “Marketing Agent”) and as custodian (in such capacity, the “Custodian”).
parties.reasoning: The opening paragraph lists all contracting parties and their roles, clearly identifying the entities bound by the agreement.

contract_type.raw_snippet:
Section 3.1 Engagement. The Issuer engages Cellco as the Servicer of the Receivables for the Issuer and the Indenture Trustee, and Cellco
accepts this engagement.
contract_type.reasoning: The core substance involves Cellco providing servicing of receivables for the Issuer; despite transfer provisions, the primary ongoing obligation is servicing, fitting a service agreement.

notice_period.reasoning: The agreement contains no auto-renewal mechanism or notice requirement to prevent renewal; termination is event/condition-based, not renewal-based.

expiration_date.raw_snippet:
Section 8.3 Termination. This Agreement will terminate on the earlier to occur of (a) the date upon which the last remaining Receivable is
paid in full, settled, sold or written off and any amounts received are applied and (b) the Issuer is terminated under Section 8.1 of the Trust
Agreement.
expiration_date.reasoning: Section 8.3 explicitly defines the term end based on specified conditions rather than a fixed date.
expiration_date.normalized_value: earlier of last remaining Receivable paid/settled/sold/written off and Issuer termination under Trust Agreement Section 8.1

renewal_term.reasoning: No renewal provisions or auto-renewal terms are present in the agreement.
